metadata.Title: CVE-2020-1934 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low.
metadata.Description:
In Apache HTTP Server 2.4.0 to 2.4.41, mod_proxy_ftp may use uninitialized memory when proxying to a malicious FTP server.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-1934` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.43-1ubuntu1
apache2-bin - 2.4.43-1ubuntu1
apache2-data - 2.4.43-1ubuntu1
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.43-1ubuntu1
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.43-1ubuntu1
apache2-utils - 2.4.43-1ubuntu1
libapache2-mod-md - 2.4.43-1ubuntu1
libapache2-mod-proxy-uwsgi - 2.4.43-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.43-1ubuntu1').
